intro: Jurinea peguensis, commonly known as the Malayan sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions like Thailand, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal environments, adapting to saline and well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the spring and summer months. Its delicate appearance and ecological adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
